cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 275 mi ESE of Marathon, Florida and 100 mi NNE of Camaguey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the Florida Keys Monday, then into the southeastern Gulf of Mexico and toward the central Gulf Coast (AL-MS-eastern LA)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Gulf Coast near the AL-MS-LA border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Alabama–Florida border westward to east of Morgan City, Louisiana, including Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, south and west-central Florida coastline, and the central Gulf Coast from the Alabama-Florida border to Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Occasional tropical-storm-force gusts possible Monday afternoon/evening (probability low ~3%)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the west-central Florida coast near Manatee County
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 1–3 inches of rain Monday; brief heavier squalls possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornado or waterspout risk in passing squalls; lightning delays to port operations
